text: The Sopot Lighthouse is a navigation facility on the Polish Baltic coast, located in Sopot. It was built in 1903–04 as a part of the Balneological Institute. The extent of its focal length of the light has since been reduced to , which, according to existing criteria, no longer formally makes it a lighthouse, although it is still called so. It is open to visitors.Polskie Latarnie (in Polish) == See also == * List of lighthouses in Poland == References == == External links == * The Lighthouses of Poland * Urząd Morski w Słupsku * Latarnia morska (Sopot) na portalu polska-org.pl Category:Lighthouses completed in 1904 Category:Resort architecture in Pomerania Category:Lighthouses in Poland Category:Buildings and structures in Sopot Category:Tourist attractions in Pomeranian Voivodeship
title: Sopot Lighthouse
